tagline: A collection of DIY Document Digitization Tools for citizens, municipalities, librarians and archivists.

# DIYBookScanner Resources

   [www.diybookscanner.org](www.diybookscanner.org) 

   [Official DIYBookScanner Github Repository](https://github.com/markvdb/diybookscanner)

   [Book Scanners on Instructables.com](http://www.instructables.com/tag/type-id/category-technology/keyword-book%20scanner/) 

   [E-Book Enlightenment](http://en.flossmanuals.net/e-book-enlightenment/scanning-book-pages/) 

   [Harvard ABCD Library Working Group](https://wiki.harvard.edu/confluence/display/abcdlib/DIY+Book+Scanners)

   [Project Gado: Archival Document Scanning](http://projectgado.org/)

    
## Hardware Builds/Tutorials

   [Tutorials/Instructions Forum](http://www.diybookscanner.org/forum/viewforum.php?f=19)

   [Easy Scanner Instructable](http://www.instructables.com/id/Bargain-Price-Book-Scanner-From-A-Cardboard-Box/)

   [Automated Scanbot](https://hackerspace.be/ScanBot)

### Raspberry Pi-powered Book Scanner
   [Ben Steinberg's RPi- DIYBookscanner Repo](https://github.com/bensteinberg/diy-bookscanner)

   [RPi Book Scanner Notes on Harvard Wiki](https://osc.hul.harvard.edu/bookscanner/)
## Software

### Camera Firmware

   [Canon Hack Development Kit (CHDK)](http://chdk.wikia.com/wiki/CHDK) CHDK is a key software package in the DIY Book Scanning community. CHDK can make your image '''acquisition''' process much easier and more efficient.

   [Canon Camera's Supported by CHDK](http://chdk.wikia.com/wiki/FAQ#Q._What_camera_models_are_supported_by_the_CHDK_program.3F)

   [Automatic Camera Identifier and Downloader (ACID)](http://www.zenoshrdlu.com/acid/acid.html) Script for Windows, OSX or Linux which automatically identifies the compatible CHDK Firmware for your camera

### Spreads: Workflow assistant for camera-based book digitization

   [Github Repo](https://github.com/jbaiter/spreads) 

   [SPREADS Documentation/Tutorial](http://spreads.readthedocs.org/en/latest/)


### Triggers

   [Software Triggering on Debian (from official diybookscanner Repo)](https://github.com/markvdb/diybookscanner/wiki/Software-triggering-on-Debian-GNU-Linux)
